content: आश्रमः, --मं [आ-श्रम् आधारे घञ् वृद्ध्य भावः] {@--1@} A hermitage, hut, cell, dwelling or abode of ascetics. {@--2@} A stage, order, or period of the (religious) life of a Brāhmaṇa. These are four:-- ब्रह्मचर्य the life of a student; गार्हस्थ्य the life of a house holder: वानप्रस्य the life of an anchorite or hermit, and संन्यास the life of a Bhikṣu or beggar. Kṣatriyas (and Vaiśyas also) can enter upon the first three Āśramas; <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Ś. 7. 20</ls>; <ls>V. 5</ls>; (according to some authorities they can enter the fourth also; <ab>cf.</ab> सकिलाश्रममंत्यमाश्रितः <ls>R. 8. 14</ls>); पूर्वाश्रमः <ls>Ku. 5. 50.</ls> {@--3@} A college, school. {@--4@} A wood or thicket (where ascetics practise penance). {@--5@} <ab>N.</ab> of Viṣṇu.
